Package model

Interface GameEngine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GameCallbackCollection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameEngineImpl
    public interface GameEngine
extends GameCallbackCollection
    The main interface in Further Programming Assignment.

    This interface should be implemented as GameEngineImpl which has a no argument constructor. All the methods in the interface need to be carefully implemented as per the Javadoc below.

    Author:
    Ross Nye
    See Also:
    GameCallbackCollection, Player, Wheel, Slot, Bet

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      The default delay increment is 10 in ms
      static int DEFAULT_FINAL_DELAY
      The default final delay is 500 in ms
      static int DEFAULT_INITIAL_DELAY

    • Method Detail

      • addPlayer

        void addPlayer​(Player player)
        throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds supplied player to the Game Engine. The supplied player must be valid player with a unique ID; if the ID already exists the add should be rejected and an exception thrown (see below).

        Hint: The unique ID should be enforced here and not in PlayerImpl class

        Parameters:
        player - the player to be added to the Game Engine
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player parameter is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a player with the same ID as the player supplied in the parameter already exists in the Game Engine
        See Also:
        Player

      • removePlayer

        void removePlayer​(java.lang.String playerId)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the player with the matching supplied ID as a parameter from the Game Engine. If the supplied ID is not valid an exception is thrown (see below).
        Parameters:
        playerId - the ID of the player that is to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the supplied player ID is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no player with a matching ID in the Game Engine
        See Also:
        Player

      • getAllPlayers

        java.util.Collection<Player> getAllPlayers()
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection (shallow copy) of all Players
        See Also:
        Player

      • placeBet

        void placeBet​(java.lang.String playerId,
              int betAmount,
              BetType betType)
       throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Places a Color based bet for the player with matching ID.

        Number bets should be placed with overloaded placeBet method. Only valid color bets, for valid players, should be accepted otherwise an exception should be thrown (see below).

        It should be possible to replace an existing bet with a new one if the new bet amount is of greater or equal value to that of the current bet.

        Once a valid bet has been assigned to the player all the registered GameCallbacks objects should be notified of the updated bet using the GameCallback.updateBet(Player, Bet) callback method.

        Note: Bets should be reset for all players by the client after a spin.

        Hint: Consider passing appropriate messages to the Exception constructors.

        Parameters:
        playerId - the ID of the player placing the bet.
        betAmount - the amount of the bet
        betType - the type of color bet to be placed: BetType.BLACK, BetType.RED, BetType.GREEN
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if supplied playerID or betType is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases
        • there is no player with a matching ID in the Game Engine
        • supplied bet amount is not a positive integer
        • bet cannot be placed as the player does not have enough points
        • cannot overwrite existing bet as new bet is of lesser value
        • supplied betType parameter is BetType.NUMBER - use overloaded method instead
        See Also:
        Player, Bet, BetType

      • placeBet

        void placeBet​(java.lang.String playerId,
              int betAmount,
              int number)
       throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Places a Number based bet for Player with matching ID. Color bets should be placed with overloaded placeBet method. Only valid number bets, for valid players, should be accepted otherwise an exception should be thrown (see below).

        It should be possible to replace an existing bet with a new one if the new bet amount is of greater or equal value to that of the current bet.

        Once a valid bet has been assigned to the player all the registered GameCallback objects should be notified of the updated bet using the GameCallback.updateBet(Player, Bet) callback method.

        Note: Bets should be reset for all players by the client after a spin.

        Hint: Consider passing appropriate messages to the Exception constructors.

        Parameters:
        playerId - the ID of the player placing the bet.
        betAmount - the amount of the bet
        number - the slot number to place the bet for
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if supplied playerID is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases
        • there is no player with a matching ID in the Game Engine
        • supplied bet amount is not a positive integer
        • bet cannot be placed as the player does not have enough points
        • cannot overwrite existing bet as new bet is of lesser value
        • supplied slot number is not a valid slot number
        See Also:
        Player, Bet, BetType

      • resetAllBets

        void resetAllBets()
        Resets all bets for all the players in the Game Engine.

        As each player's bet is reset all the registered GameCallback objects should be notified of the updated bet using the GameCallback.updateBet(Player, Bet) callback method.

        Note: Bets should be reset for all players by the client after a spin.

        See Also:
        Player.resetBet()

      • selectStartingSlot

        Slot selectStartingSlot()
        Returns a random starting slot from the wheel.

        Once the random slot is determined all GameCallback objects registered with the Game Engine should be notified of the random slot using the GameCallback.initialSlot(Slot) method.

        All callbacks should be notified of the same slot, which should be the same slot returned from this method.

        Note: This method should be called as a part of the spin process and exists as a separate public method to facilitate automatic testing.

        Returns:
        random starting slot
        See Also:
        Slot, Wheel, Wheel.generateRandomPosition(), Wheel.moveToPosition(int), GameCallback, GameCallback.initialSlot(Slot)

      • spinWheel

        Slot spinWheel()
        Overloaded method that uses the default delay parameters to spin the wheel
        Returns:
        winning slot
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_DELAY_INCREMENT, DEFAULT_FINAL_DELAY, DEFAULT_DELAY_INCREMENT, spinWheel(int, int, int), Wheel, Slot

      • spinWheel

        Slot spinWheel​(int initialDelay,
               int finalDelay,
               int delayIncrement)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Spins the wheel.

        Spinning the wheel can be broken down into the following steps

        1. Select a random starting slot and notify all registered GameCallback
        2. Using the three delay parameters appropriately
          1. Delay for current delay ms, starting initially with initial delay value
          2. Advance the wheel to the next slot
          3. Notify all of the new registered GameCallback via GameCallback.advanceSlot(Slot)
          4. Increment the delay
          5. Repeat as long as the final delay has not been reached
        3. Finalise the spin; apply betting results and notify all registered GameCallback
        Parameters:
        initialDelay - the initial delay in ms
        finalDelay - the final delay in ms
        delayIncrement - the delay increment in ms
        Returns:
        the winning slot
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases based on the three delay parameters
        • initialDelay is zero or less
        • finalDelay is zero or less
        • delayIncrement is one or less
        • initalDelay is NOT less than finalDelay
        • based on all three parameters the spin loop would happen only once (or less)
        See Also:
        Wheel, Slot, GameCallback, GameCallback.advanceSlot(Slot), Thread.sleep(long)

      • finaliseSpin

        void finaliseSpin​(Slot slot)
        This methods is run at the completion of a spin to finalise the results.

        It applies the betting results based on the supplied winning slot parameter.

        Firstly all the GameCallback objects registered with the Game Engine should be notified of the winning slot via the GameCallback.winningSlot(Slot) method. All the callbacks should be notified of the same slot, which should be the same as to slot returned from this method.

        After notifying all the callbacks of the winning slot all the player bets should then be finalised, notifying all the registered GameCallback of each update via the GameCallback.updateBet(Player, Bet) method while doing so.

        Note: This method should be called as a part of the spin process and exists as a separate public method to facilitate testing.

        Parameters:
        slot - the winning slot
        See Also:
        Slot, GameCallback, GameCallback.winningSlot(Slot), GameCallback.updateBet(Player, Bet), Player, Bet
